thread.title: Retired Ranger Prince Fielder to host cooking show on Netflix and Hulu called 'Fielder's Choice'
thread.title_full: Retired Ranger Prince Fielder to host cooking show on Netflix and Hulu called 'Fielder's Choice'

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Retired Ranger Prince Fielder to host cooking show on Netflix and Hulu called 'Fielder's Choice'
text:
Now reading the latest in Rangers News This story is about Rangers Published Retired Ranger Prince Fielder to host cooking show on Netflix and Hulu called 'Fielder's Choice' This Story is About...   Staff   designated hitter Prince Fielder walks in with his sons Jadyn Fielder (left) and Haven Fielder, before speaking at a press conference at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas Wednesday August 10, 2016. It was announced that Fielder's career is ending due to his second spinal fusion surgery in the last 27 months. Fielder will be declared "medically disabled," since doctors will not clear him to play baseball due to the risk involved with the two fusions. (Andy Jacobsohn/The   SportsDayDFW.com Contact SportsDayDFW.com on Twitter: @SportsDayDFW 
It was tough to watch â€” when Rangers DH Prince Fielder tearfully announced his retirement from the game of baseball due to medical issues. 
Surrounded by his two sons, Jadyn and Haven, Fielder was forced to give up the game he loved much too soon after his second spinal fusion surgery. 'I thought I was just going to cry in the car': Emotional Prince Fielder says goodbye to baseball 
For many professional athletes, life after sports can be difficult to navigate. For Fielder, though, it hasn't taken long for him to find his stride. 
In an interview with ESPN's Jerry Crasnick, Fielder discussed what he's been up to in the six months from his retirement announcement . 
"I'm just living a normal life -- a regular life, as people would call it. I'm enjoying it. I'm still working out. It keeps me feeling good about things. I get to kind of pretend I'm going to play baseball. I get to work out and do all the stuff that was part of baseball. I just don't get to play." 
Fielder has other activities to keep him busy as well including a new cooking show with his wife called "Fielder's Choice" 
"I have a food show that's going to be streaming on Netflix and Hulu. It's coming out around the beginning of spring training in March, I believe. It's not just baseball people. It's a mixture of baseball people, actors, musicians, chefs and whatnot. They bring out different dishes, and at the end of the show, I give the one I like the most the "Fielder's choice." It's good TV." 
"How did that come about," Crasnick asked. 
" A friend of mine asked me a question at the end of 2015. We were going over my finances and setting things up for the future when she said, 'What do you want to do when you retire?' I said, 'I always wanted to do a food show.' I thought it might be a cool thing to do when I retired a few years later. Then retirement came slightly prematurely." 
The entire Q&A with Fielder dives into how the former DH plans to help the Rangers in 2017, his relationship with his father and what he'll miss most about baseball among several other topics. Click here for the entire story. This Topic is Missing Your Voice. View Comments
